explanation: The report is correct. Given the provided macro definition #define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0), the initialization int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg); always yields 0, so the controlling expression if (err) is invariant (always false). This is not one of the permitted exceptions to MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 (the allowed exceptions are infinite-loop invariants and the specific do-while integer-constant case). The fact that the comma-expression contains (void)cfg only prevents it from being an integer constant expression syntactically, but it is still semantically invariant at runtime, and therefore violates Rule 14.3.
